title: First M2 Max benchmark scores appear to leak on Geekbench
description: If the scores are legit, they show fairly modest gains compared to the M1 Max.

title: Disney’s new neural network can change an actor’s age with ease
description: "Production ready" neural net makes actors younger or older for film or TV.

title: Astronomers capture black hole gobbling up a star in a “hyper-feeding frenzy”
description: “It’s probably swallowing the star at the rate of half the mass of the sun per year.”

title: San Francisco allows police to use robots to remotely kill suspects
description: The SFPD is now authorized to use explosive robots when lives are at stake.

title: New device can make hydrogen when dunked in salt water
description: Device structure does energy-free desalination before water is split.

title: How Jaguar uses Formula E to make better road EVs
description: From software to silicon carbide inverters, the sport's not just entertainment.

title: EU threatens Musk with Twitter ban as firm defends new approach to moderation
description: Twitter claims "none of our policies have changed" after abandoning COVID policy.

title: Google customers win class-action status in lawsuit over app store prices
description: Customers claim that Google Play artificially inflated app prices.

title: Apple tries to improve iPhone 14’s crash detection with iOS 16.1.2
description: A much bigger iOS update numbered 16.2 is expected soon.

title: Play app with 100K downloads booted for forwarding texts to developer server
description: Texts were used to provide verification codes for fraudulent accounts.

title: Eufy’s “No clouds” cameras upload facial thumbnails to AWS
description: Company says it should have better informed users of how it sends mobile alerts.

title: Judge approves $50 million settlement over broken MacBook butterfly keyboards
description: Only affected users living in specific states will be eligible for payouts.

title: Former Musk ally explains resignation from Twitter, cites “dictatorial edict”
description: Former safety chief Yoel Roth's advice for Musk: "Humility goes a really long way."

title: Modern trackball mouse wants to be a wireless solution to your ergonomic woes
description: Trackball mice are still niche, but modern features keep new releases relevant.

title: Homeopath who made thousands on bogus COVID pellets gets nearly 3 years in prison
description: Before sentencing, Juli Mazi claimed she had "sovereign immunity."

title: SpaceX set to launch two spacecraft to the Moon tonight
description: ispace is seeking to become the first private company to successfully land on the Moon.

title: Nintendo tells Smash World Tour it can no longer operate unlicensed tournaments
description: Months of licensing talks fall apart, dooming December championship and 2023 season.

title: Musk won’t relaunch Twitter Blue until he finds a way to avoid Apple fees

title: OnePlus beats Google with four years of major OS updates
description: OnePlus and Samsung are now tied in having the longest update plans.

title: Starlink prices in Ukraine nearly double as mobile networks falter
description: Russian assault on electricity grid drives Starlink prices up.

title: Review: Intel’s “Raptor Canyon” NUC is a compact gaming PC without the stress
description: Building your own can be considerably cheaper, but DIY-ing isn't always easy.
